why_this_works.intro: ## Why This Works For Your Business

reasoning_points.template: ‚úì **{business_model_label}** businesses excel with this model because {business_model_reason}
‚úì This offer is specifically designed to {goal_alignment_description}

win_your_money_back: **Tracking System:** Must reliably track customer completion (70% hit their goal in successful programs)
**Strong Backend:** Main profit comes from upsells and repeat purchases, not front-end
**Clear Criteria:** Define exactly what actions qualify for refund (workouts logged, modules completed, etc.)
**Testimonial Strategy:** Majority who succeed become case studies and advocates
**Store Credit Preferred:** Offering store credit vs cash refund keeps money in ecosystem
giveaway: **Meaningful Prize:** Must be valuable enough to attract attention (scholarship, full program, etc.)
**Legal Compliance:** Publish clear terms & conditions, check local sweepstakes laws
**Non-Winner Offer:** 80-90% of entrants should get discounted offer (partial scholarship)
**Backend Upsells:** Make profit on what people buy after entering, not on entry
**Volume Capacity:** Must handle large influx of leads without breaking systems
decoy_offer: **Three-Tier Pricing:** Good, Better, Best structure required
**Premium Positioning:** 70-80% should choose premium when positioned correctly
**Immediate Profit:** This model profits on front-end, not just backend
**Clear Differentiation:** Each tier must have obvious value differences
**Anchor Pricing:** Most expensive option makes premium look reasonable
buy_x_get_y_free: **Repeat Purchase:** Only works if customers buy multiple times (supplements, meals, etc.)
**Margin Buffer:** Must afford to give away free units without losing money
**Volume Capacity:** Expect significant spike in orders
**Perceived Value:** 'Get 2 Free' feels better than 33% discount even if same math
**Clear Redemption:** Simple rules for claiming free units
pay_less_now_or_pay_more_later: **Strong Urgency:** Must have real deadline (price increases X date, spots fill, etc.)
**Backend Revenue:** Comfortable with delayed cashflow, profit comes later
**Satisfaction Guarantee:** If not satisfied, they pay nothing more
**Clear Price Increase:** Specific dollar amount increase if they wait
**Follow-Up Sequence:** Strong email sequence to convert 'wait and see' prospects
free_with_consumption_to_upsell: **Natural Upsell Path:** Trial must naturally lead to wanting more
**Low Delivery Cost:** Free trial can't hurt margins significantly
**Educational Approach:** Use free session to break false beliefs, not just pitch
**Strong Backend:** All profit comes from upsell, not free offer
**Qualification Filter:** Free trial should still attract right people, not tire-kickers

show_if_no_backend.message: üö® **Critical:** Build your backend monetization FIRST before launching any attraction offer. Most offers lose money on the front-end and profit on upsells.

show_if_low_margin.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è **Margin Warning:** Your margins may be too low for generous attraction offers. Focus on volume-based offers or improve margins first.

show_if_no_tracking.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è **Tracking Limitation:** Without tracking capability, you're limited to simple offers like giveaways and basic discounts.

legal_disclaimers.giveaway: **Legal Disclaimer:** Sweepstakes and giveaways may be subject to federal and state regulations. Consult with legal counsel and publish clear official rules including: no purchase necessary, eligibility requirements, prize details, odds of winning, and how winner is selected. Some states require registration for prizes over certain values.

standard_steps.action: Review the complete funnel template above
standard_steps.details: Customize headlines, offer structure, and email sequences for your specific business

Use headline examples and offer structure from template
Implement tracking for all key metrics listed above
Build backend monetization path following upsell template
Validate conversion rates before scaling spend

explanation.template: Based on your answers, no attraction offer achieved our minimum confidence threshold of {min_confidence}%. This typically means some prerequisites need to be in place first.

no_backend.message: üö® **No Backend Monetization:** Most attraction offers require strong backend upsells to be profitable. This is your #1 priority.
no_backend.action: Build a backend offer that converts 30%+ of front-end customers before creating attraction offer

low_margin.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è **Low Margins:** Margins under 40% limit your attraction offer options significantly.
low_margin.action: Focus on improving margins or choose volume-based models only

no_tracking.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è **No Tracking Capability:** This eliminates result-based offers like Win Your Money Back.
no_tracking.action: Implement basic tracking systems or stick to simple giveaway/discount models

no_capacity.message: ‚ö†Ô∏è **No Capacity:** Can't run volume-driving offers if you can't serve customers.
no_capacity.action: Focus on exclusive, controlled-volume offers like Decoy pricing

safe_starting_point.title: Safe Starting Point While Building
safe_starting_point.suggestion: Simple content lead magnet or small discount
safe_starting_point.description: While you build prerequisites, use a basic free guide, checklist, or 10-15% discount to generate leads. Don't run aggressive attraction offers until backend is in place.

business_model.digital_product: Digital products have excellent margins and easy delivery, making you flexible for most offers
business_model.coaching_consulting: Coaching/consulting businesses excel with trust-building offers that demonstrate expertise
business_model.physical_product: Physical products work great with Buy X Get Y Free due to repeat purchase nature
business_model.membership_subscription: Subscription models benefit from free trials that convert to recurring revenue
business_model.saas_software: SaaS excels with Free With Consumption due to low marginal cost of additional users
business_model.agency: Agency work requires trust and proof, making Win Your Money Back and case studies powerful
business_model.hybrid: Hybrid models give you flexibility to test multiple attraction offer types

gross_margin.under_40_percent: provides limited flexibility - focus on volume offers rather than generous giveaways
gross_margin.40_60_percent: gives you decent flexibility for most offers if you have strong backend
gross_margin.60_85_percent: gives you strong flexibility for bonuses, trials, and generous front-end offers
gross_margin.85_plus_percent: allows maximum flexibility - you can afford generous free trials and guarantees

cashflow_tolerance.must_profit_front_end: means you need offers that profit immediately (Decoy Offer is best option)
cashflow_tolerance.break_even_is_okay: opens up most attraction offer possibilities with backend monetization
cashflow_tolerance.can_afford_short_term_loss: gives you maximum flexibility for aggressive customer acquisition
cashflow_tolerance.can_run_free_front_end: unlocks all attraction strategies including pure giveaways

capacity.high_capacity_can_handle_big_spike: makes you perfect for volume offers like giveaways and Buy X Get Y
capacity.moderate_capacity_some_limitations: works well with most balanced attraction offers
capacity.low_capacity_can_only_take_a_few: requires quality-over-volume offers like Decoy pricing
capacity.no_capacity_need_to_control_volume: limits you to exclusive, premium positioning only

tracking_ability.can_track_everything: unlocks result-based offers like Win Your Money Back
tracking_ability.can_track_some_things: works for most offers except strict completion-based models
tracking_ability.tracking_is_difficult: limits you to simpler offers without completion requirements
tracking_ability.cannot_track_results_at_all: restricts you to basic giveaways and discount offers

backend_strength.multiple_strong_upsells_and_backend: gives you the foundation to run generous front-end offers profitably
backend_strength.one_strong_backend_offer: provides the upsell path needed for most attraction offers
backend_strength.weak_backend_working_on_it: means you should strengthen backend before aggressive front-end offers
backend_strength.no_backend_offer_yet: is a critical gap - build backend monetization FIRST
